COMMENT_TX: $Shotton ran up the line and dased toward home as soon as the ball left Carlson's hand.
$Hamilton replaced Carlson with a 2-2 count on McHenry.
Nicholson lost the ball in the sun.
Hollocher threw the ball to first but according to Umpire Emslie's ruling, Barber was pulled off the bag.  Killefer was ejected.
$Meusel lost the ball in the sun.
$Southworth was called out when Cutshaw interfered with Wheat
Doyle ejected by Klem for arguing 3rd strike call

$Yes, out 54; aborted double SB Schmidt trapped Burns off 3B and ran him back and tagged him and tossed ball to mound; as Pirates left field Klem managed to convey safe call. Burns tried to score but alert Whitted recovered ball and fired to Cutshaw covering home to get Burns
$In scramble for ball Barnes and Snyder collided heavily,both dazed but continue
Caton was hit by his own batted ball.
$Terrific foul by Whitted hit little boy who was carried out
Schmidt thought ball went into LF, so ran into Kilduff's tag
Ward and Wheat got signals crossed
Carey tried for a diving catch.
Stock tried for second but was boxed.  Schultz was then trapped trying to go home and was trapped.  Stock made third as Schmidt tagged Schultz out.
Ball caromed off Terry's leg into Hollocher's hands.
Nicholson dropped the pop but Umpire Rigler ruled an infield fly.
Schmidt sustained an injured finger on a foul ball.
Lee was hit on the hand by his own foul ball.
Cutshaw took Carey's throw and tried to head off the runner at third but threw over Whitted's head.
Bigbee lost the ball in the sun.
Carey was boxed as he tried to go to second and the play was diverted to Bigbee who was run down.
Bigbee tried to score when Mann's throw got away from Boeckel.
3 consecutive triples--this is or ties NL record (many times
Giants set record for most runs 17th--never matched
Southworth bunted past Doyle and tried for double
Burns trapped Whitted's fly for DPO but Rigler called inffly
Bancroft argued Moran's out call and was ejected
Pirates surrounded Moran after out call.Pop bottles thrown  from grandstand--one hits Pirates' Schmidt on R leg-painful injury
Southworth liner hit Nehf in stomach, Nehf made play then collapsed, but recovered and insisted on continuing
Grimes ejected 'off pitchers' bench for talking out of turn' by Harrison
$First pitch to Olson with Haeffner at catcher hit Haeffner's bare hand and he had to leave game

Hornsby ran in the line and stopped as Whitted intercepted Bigbee's throw.  McHenry ran off second too far on the play and was boxex when Whitted threw to Cutshaw.  Cutshaw ran McHenry toward third and when Hornsby started home, he was out, Cutshaw to Haeffner.
Carey caught the ball and held it momentarily, then dropped the ball.
$Game called so teams could catch a train.
Rixey deflected the ball to Rawlings.
Runners advanced as LeBourveau held the ball.
Southworth and Olsen collided full speed, about to fight  when Rigler stepped between them
Bigbee bad hop into Kilduff's face
says Schmidt tried sac, but Whitted did get to 2B so should be sac unless already Whitted at 2B (or 73 looked ahead 1x3)
Actually Kelly singled out of turn. Pirate appeal-Smith out
Caromed off Tyler into left field.
$Southworth tried to score when O'Farrel's throw went into center field.
$Daly trapped McKechnie off first with a throw to Merkle but Merkle, in trying to get Grimm who started for third, threw wide to the stands.
Groh made a delayed steal of third when Schmidt, thinking Neale had swung at a third strike, walked toward the bench.
Bigbee lost the ball in the sun.
$Doak threw to first to catch Carey napping.  Max started for second and beat Fournier's throw.
Traynor threw wild to first but Grimm retrieved the ball and threw to Traynor getting Rariden trying for second.
$Allen was wounded on the bare hand by a foul tip.
Barnhart muffed Whitted's throw and Sicking was safe.
